page.title: 12Religion
page.content: Religion in Denby has declined in recent years. The{only church}now in use is{St Johns}which became part of the Wakefield Diocese in 1888. However, there has been a church on this sight since 850 AD when the village was called Denebi and was settled by the Danes. The{congregation at the church is now{small}and the church shares a vicar with 2 neighbouring villages of Denby Dale and Cumberworth. The vicarage is now a private property. Many people in the village are{Quakers}and attend the{Meeting House at High Flatts. Many people also attend the{Methodist {Church}in Denby Dale.
